name: Soho Hotel

reviews.title: WARNING.................Never ever stay here !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: following our weekend stay in Barcelona we were contacted by the hotel to inform us that one rooms had not been paid for and that a member of our group would be charged through their credit card as a result. The room in question was paid by cash on check in and the key for the room was issued. The hotel refused to hand over the key without being paid, so it had to be paid for.

reviews.title: Soho Hotel-Great Staff and Location
reviews.text: The payment for the room was credited before we were informed that it was going to be taken and to me they knew exactly what they were doing and it would not surprise me if this was not the first time this happened. How could a hotel let a group of people leave the hotel without paying for a room....I think that emphasises my comments above. We will be making a formal complaint to the Embassy and to as may hotel booking systems on the internet that are available.......NEVER EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Soho Hotel in August of this year and had a fantastic experience. I travel to Europe quite frequently and quite a few times I've been surprisingly dissapointed by the hotels I've booked, no air conditioning, small room etc...in summary they were vastly different than their description.
reviews.title: not as good as reviews

reviews.text: This being my first trip to Barcelona I didn't know what to expect. That being said, the Soho was fantastic. It's in a great location about a block from the top of the Ramblas. The hotel is clean, funky and everything works! They have very relaxing rooftop pool, small but refreshing with a garden surrounding it on the roof. They also have computers in a cool lounge and they work.
reviews.title: SOHO a tuch of class in Barcelona

likes.liked: — Loved the modern look and feel.

reviews.text: Most of all, I liked the staff. Alessio, is just a great manager. He made us feel like family and even went out to dinner with us at one of his favorite places! You'll never find anyone who will go out of his way like he does. Also, Barcelona is great. It's clean, gorgeous, like a Paris with beaches. Also, ask Oliver for his favorite Tapas bar if you don't want to make tourist mistakes.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the nicely appointed rooms.

reviews.text: Great Núñez i Navarro design hotel with funky rooms and nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Great overall experience...

likes.disliked: — Having to walk 15-20 minutes daily to get to L Rambla

reviews.text: + We really liked the funky rooms and the great terrace on the roof.
reviews.title: Stylish and Sexy!!

likes.liked: — The stylish, contemporary decor.... very sexy!!
likes.disliked: — The traffic noise outside at night.

reviews.title: Stylish and Sophisticated
reviews.text: + We enjoyed the nice breakfast and the fair room rates.
+ We accepted having to walk 15 minutes to reach La Rambla.
reviews.title: Modern, sheek hotel. Wonderful stay...

reviews.text: - A real pool would have been nice.
reviews.title: The sexiest hotel at a very reasonable price

likes.disliked: — Think the cleaning staff mistakenly threw the lid for my bottle of lotion away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having previously stayed at the Hotel Jazz in Barcelona we thought we'd give one of their sister hotels a go and chose the Soho hotel on Gran Vía Corts. What a great idea that was!
reviews.title: I doubt it get's better than this

likes.liked: — Spotless rooms - great staff - ideal location.

reviews.text: After an easy journey from the airport via the aerobus we strolled through the Barcelona sunshine to the hotel which is just 5 minutes away from the Plaça de Catalunya.
reviews.title: LOVED the SOHO!! Should be a 4*

likes.liked: — Everything, honestly there was nothing not to like it was AMAZING
likes.disliked: — if anything more lighting in the bathroom

reviews.text: We were greeted by a smiling receptionist who booked us is with efficiency and politeness. Our room was a double with terrace at the rear of the hotel and it was perfect. Lots of space, a bathroom with a bath so comfortable we have decided to buy the same make for our bathroom at home, a wall of windows with blinds operated by the flick of a switch, a well stocked minibar, a large flat screen TV and one of the best beds I've had the pleasure to sleep in.
reviews.title: Loved it !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a roof terrace with pool and a media centre downstairs with free internet access.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.text: Every member of staff we encountered was pleasant, helpful and had a genuine interest in us as guests of their hotel. This quality in the staff shone through with the only problem we encountered during our stay when we were woken by loud music and shouting coming from an adjoining building at 1am.
reviews.title: young and pretty hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fabulous time. The hotel was beyond our expectations. The staff were amazing, food was delicious the decor was outstanding, its exactly how you see it on their website and we didnt want to leave. Such good value for money.Overall, we had a fab time. We have recommended you to any of the people who have asked about our holiday.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

likes.disliked: — that it was non smoking so I had to go outside everytime i wanted one, but hey what can ya do.

reviews.text: Joeleen & Ian
reviews.title: Fantastic Modern Hotel with some great english lads

likes.disliked: — That we didn't speak to those lovely boys more!!!

reviews.text: We got back from our vacation on Saturday after a fabulous time in the hotel Soho! When we first arrived we were greeted by a beautifully modern reception, although the guy behind the desk looked a bit moody. After a smooth check in we went up to our room and were equally impressed with the design although felt the room could have been a little larger. We actually saw into one of the back rooms and they looked a little bigger so it would be a good idea to request one of those if you can.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Good Location

likes.disliked: — Lack of kettle in the room!!!!

reviews.text: The rooftop pool was great, with really nice views over the city. That said it wasn't really a swimming pool, more of a slash pool - in fact we found that out the hard way when someone decided to jump in followed by his friend soaking the whole place, including my book, whilst we were sunbathing. He was part of a large group of guys staying there, at first they were quite noisy and we wondered if this would spoil the pool area. In fact it turned out that they were really nice guys (and a treat to look at) there on a stag party for a guy called Paul if I remember correctly...Good luck with the wedding Paul!!!
reviews.title: A+++++
Great hotel
reviews.text: Oh one last thing I almost forgot... the showers actually have a see through wall that at a push of a button can go opaque...quite a fun feature... pity we didn't get those guys to try it out with us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Deciding where to go on a city-trip can take some time - searching for a hotel that fits the bill usually takes even a little bit longer. We like contemporary looks - nice design-features and good quality - all at affordable prices - and that is what SOHO in Barcelona offers. They have worked with real qualitative materials in a creative way. The entrance is so subtle you easily walk past the front-door. Stairs going down, take you to the multi-media room, with easy chairs to relax, a small library and free internet - stairs going up, take you to the stylish lounge and breakfast area. The rooms have a couple of nice features like soft and hot light to adapt the atmosphere to your own state of mind, there is a glass see-through wall between the bath-tub an the bedroom - which can be blocked for privacy if wanted - and different sliding doors allow the space to be used in an efficient way. Design-features include the Artemide lamp-shades that can be swung in different directions, the nice Grohe taps in the bathroom and the don't disturb magnet to be stuck on the door when in need for some privacy. The rooftop swimming pool and relaxing-area allows you to forget you are actually staying just a short walk from the centre of this great city. So where are the drawbacks you wonder? Of course the neighbourhood is noisy - then again so is every big city. Apart from that there is nothing we can think of. Breakfast has something for everyone also offering some real Spanish delicacies. Finally the staff are also really helpful and bring a smile to your face. Glad to have stayed a week at SOHO and for sure happy to come again!
reviews.title: Stylish Soho

likes.liked: — the design, the quality in everything
likes.disliked: — this is the centre of a city - so it is noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my hubby decided to visit Barcelona to celebrate my 40th (sshhh) birthday and chose the Soho following reading other reviews on TripAdvisor and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is situated about 10-15 mins walk from La Ramblas so an excellent location, it's modern, clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast selection was lovely, the bed and pillows were really comfy, etc, etc. The only citicism I have is that the soap didn't last very long and even though it was replenished each day it was very small! (I would recommend earplugs as the hotel is on a very busy road and near an emergency department so lots of sirens throughout the night - but don't let this put you off!). Barcelona is truely wonderful and the architecture stunning, there is plenty to see and do and a trip to Sagrada Familia is top priority! Using the Metro is a doddle for getting to those far away places such as Park Guell (be warned - there is the steepest street in the whole world to traverse before getting to the Park, there are even escalators every so often for the unfit (like us!)), it is also good just strolling around the city and seeing what you come across. The Aerobus is the best way to get from and back to the airport (bus stops easily noticable and frequent buses) as a taxi fare would cost a bomb! ! Enjoy your stay in Barcelona!
reviews.title: Would definately stay again!
Fantastic
reviews.text: Wow what a hotel. Fantastic location, fantastic decor, fantastic facilities, but above all fantastic staff. I was made very welcome. Alessio (hotel reception) gave great suggestions for restaurants, bars ect. I will definately be staying at The Soho next time i'm in Barelona. Enjoy....
Hotel clean, modern, funky, good location, great base in the city. Great value compared to some other hotels. Good price for hotel with a pool to dip your feet in after a hard days sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great base in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Wonderful ending to our vacation!

likes.liked: — The location, modern look and feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and i stayed at The Soho for one night in Barcelona and wished we could have stayed there longer. The hotel is centrally located between the L'Eixample and Gothic quarter on La Gran Via. We must have gotten a room upgrade as we had a top floor room with a large balcony overlooking La Gran Via. The room was very large with a comfortable large bed and sitting area. The patio was a nice addition to enjoy the fresh air and city views. The windows seemed to block out most of the street noise, so that was not an issue for me.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: We included breakfast with our room rate, which was a nice assortment of meats, cheeses, fruits, breads and other hot food items. The mini bar was also nicely stocked with well priced wine and cava.
reviews.title: Great Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we didn't have much time to enjoy the roof top pool and deck, it was nice to enjoy a light snack delivered at sunset while resting up for a long evening.
reviews.title: FABULOUS

reviews.text: All hotel staff members were extremely friendly and helpful and spoke great English.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in a perfect place

likes.liked: — Central location, great breakfast and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — A bit noisy from the traffic on Gran Via but you're staying in a city and get used to it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would come back to the Soho in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Modern, Stylish, Centrally Located

likes.disliked: — No restaurant or bar, only BBC was in English, WiFi not consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A perfect place to visit Barcelona, away from the crowded, far too touristic Ramblas. This hotel just has it all: the right atmosphere, design, staff, very good beds, delicious breakfast. It works! We loved it!
reviews.title: How It Always Should Be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. We where advised not to stay on Las Rambla as it was too busy so we looked at surrounding areas. Hotel Soho was a 5 -10 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya, from here you have all the restaurants, shops and the beach within walking distance. Soho was very modern, clean and the staff couldn't have been more friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A bit of class in Barcelona

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel SOHO for a total of 10 days. The front desk staff were always polite, friendly, and very helpful, especially Allesio! :) They recommended restaurants and things to do, and even booked the reservations and drew us a map! The hotel is within walking distance to La Rambla and has a metro station directly in front of it, making it convenient to any area of Barcelona. The rooms were very modern yet comfortable, although the walls were rather thin making it easy to hear our neighbors at times. The little pastries they offer at breakfast are quiet delicious!
reviews.title: Great Place, Friendly Staff, Convenient Location

reviews.text: The rooms are colorful and fashionable while still being comfortable.
reviews.title: Great room, friendly staff

reviews.text: This is the first hotel that I've been in that you could vary the color temperature of the lighting (making it warmer or cooler depending upon your mood).
reviews.title: wonderfull stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives
reviews.title: Overrated

likes.disliked: — rude staff and poor breakfast...no fresh coffee!

reviews.text: Big comfy bed
reviews.title: Great hotel in the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice lighting effects
reviews.title: OK, but improvements needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet rooms but only the cheaper ones with no view.
reviews.title: Not a great hotel!
Good value for money
reviews.text: Negs

description: Hotel Soho welcomes its guests with a glassed-in lobby and offers 51 rooms, outdoor terrace and pool with panoramas overlooking Barcelona, a media center with free Internet access, a breakfast-room with terrace on the ground floor, free WiFi throughout the building, and private parking facilities.
